pr_title: Distinguish between "no opinion" and "keep current allocation"

timeline.message:
Distinguish between "no opinion" and "keep current allocation"

This is necessary when multiple config servers runs autoscaling in
parallel and redeployment takes along time.

timeline.bodyText:
Shouldn't this return currentAllocation?
In the case this is meant to fix:

cfg1 calculates a new target, t1, and deploys with it
cfg2 decides that the new target, t2, which is not sufficiently different from the current, so it returns empty, which means that target t1 is cleared
On the next deploy, on any cfg: There is no target and the nodes provisioned with t1 are not yet active, so it will revert back to the previous target (per NodeRepositoryProvsioner::currentResources)
timeline.author: freva

replies.bodyText: Current isn't the current target but the current allocation (active nodes).
replies.author: bratseth
